item.title: Report X-2024020809
item.description:
Report X-2024020809

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA from unload in a tote with contents leaking from the outside. I realized it was a damage Hazmat and took it to the Hazmat Cage to start processing. DescribePack: Box was ripped from the opening, down the side to the bottom. Hydrogen Peroxide and Peroxyacetic Acid mixture stabilized, 5.1 (8), 11, 3.781, Oxidizer Corrosive inside of a plastic bag that was leaking contents. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a hazardous materials bag inside a yellow drum. I used the chemical neutralizer on the visible spilled liquid. This is a Class 8 liquid, so I confirmed neutralization using the PH test. Levels were between 6-9, at 8. Once there was no heat and had cooled down, I placed the fiberboard box in the drum and secured the bag with a zip tie. Drum is sealed and waiting to be picked up by authorized personnel.

item.title: Report X-2024020419
item.description:
Report X-2024020419

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Jerrican was found in QA department with a wet spot around spout. PH paper was used to figure out if liquid was from hazmat or another source. PH paper indicated a PH of 1. Further inspection of jerrican showed that cap was misaligned and had allowed product to leak out during transit. DescribePack: Cap was not screwed into threads properly causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Jerrican was kept in a lined tote and in an upright position.

item.title: Report X-2024020650
item.description:
Report X-2024020650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking drum, when QA arrived it was discovered that the drum was a hazmat. Spill pads were used to clean up the leaked product and drum was brought to the middle area for processing. DescribePack: Bottom of drum was dented during handling causing damage and allowing product to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put upside down in a lined tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020371
item.description:
Report X-2024020371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024020371 SequenceEvent: The cap became loose causing it to spill. The manager called QA we secured the hazmat in a lined red tote. The spillage only soiled the outer packaging. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote. 2. X-2024020381 SequenceEvent: The cap became loose causing it to leak on the outer packaging. The manager called QA, we secured the package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.description:
Report X-2024020441

  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The contents were found with a torn box and the contents were also leaking. upon being found, the items were brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The box was torn and the contents were leaking out. Once the box was open, the pail inside was noticed to be damaged on the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a salvage drum to prevent further leakage.

item.description:
Report X-2024020484

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. Upon being found, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The package had noticeable liquid damage in a corner. When the package was inspected, one of the bottles was found to have a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.
